basic_info.description: ðŸ‘‹ My name is Genevieve DuPuy, she/her, and I'm a full stack software dev based just north of Seattle in beautiful rural Snohomish, WA. Before diving into tech my background ran the gamut from customer service, to the restaurant industry, to teaching dance. Most recently my work has been as a small business owner and esthetician/sugarist. I'm passionate about working with people and stretching myself creatively. In building my own business I always wished for more tech savvy, so one of my goals is to use my experience in software development to help creatives and other small business folx bring their visions to life online, and in doing so, enrich local community. I love that there is always something new and exciting around the corner to learn, especially in the world of tech, and I'm looking forward to contributing to its diversification by adding my own unique voice to the mix. ðŸ’œ

projects.title: Pair Panic
projects.description: This was a collaborative group final project for Code Fellows 201 coding course made by Genevieve DuPuy, Drew Stroede, Justin Benjamin, and Ariania Palmer. We created a web application using a matching card game where the goal is to match 8 pets in the least amount of moves possible (16). The app showcases HTML, CSS, JavaScript, our furry pets, and a ChatGPT Thundercats origin story. It features game logic in order to detect matching or non-matching cards, count your moves and place your score.

projects.title: Gallery of Horns
projects.description: This was another fun project for Code Fellows coding 301 showcasing a gallery of fabulous horned beasts of which can pick your favorite!

projects.title: Odd Duck
projects.description: This was a whimsical project built for Code Fellows 201 coding course highlighting skills in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and local storage. Built using VS Code on a MacBook Pro utilizing HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Chart.js, and local storage.
